intro: Hieracium euronotum, commonly known as the European meadowhawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and basal rosette of leaves, which help it survive in various habitats. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils across Europe. Hieracium euronotum is known for its ability to thrive in a range of soil types and environmental conditions.
